Explanations:
ProSpecieRara: This variety has been awarded by ProSpecieRara as a rare or old variety. ProSpecieRara is a foundation dedicated to preserving the diversity of rare plant varieties. In long-term cooperation with ProSpecieRara, Sativa is active in the important preservation and cultivation of these traditional varieties.
Conservation Breeding: For this variety Sativa practices conservation breeding in Rheinau. To ensure high-quality varieties, they must be maintained. They are regularly replicated and selected by their positive characteristics. In doing so the varieties are continually improved and adapted to growing conditions.
Name: BLACK
Description:
bo14
Vigorous bean for dry seed use. Pods shortish, broad and stringy. Late ripening into attractive small round black seeds. Creamy and nutty flavour.
Type: bush shell bean

Name: NEW
Description:
BLACK TURTLE
bo15
Early, high-yielding, black shell bean with a nice flavor. Bushy growth. Shows very good resistance to rust and bean mosaic virus. Sclerotinia-resistant. Improved variant of the original Black Turtle variety.
Type: bush shell bean

Explanations:
ProSpecieRara: This variety has been awarded by ProSpecieRara as a rare or old variety. ProSpecieRara is a foundation dedicated to preserving the diversity of rare plant varieties. In long-term cooperation with ProSpecieRara, Sativa is active in the important preservation and cultivation of these traditional varieties.

Name: BLAUHILDE
Description:
bo70
Early-ripening, abundantly producing variety for unprotected propagation. Blauhilde's round pod are blue to purple, fleshy and thick. The pods are tasty and turn dark green when cooked.
Type: climbing bean

Name: BORLOTTO
Description:
LAMON
bo79
Climbing shell bean with a superb flavor. The freshly shelled beans are delicious but can also be dried like any other Bortlotti bean. Shell beans are robust but require sufficient warmth to ripen.
Type: climbing shell bean

Name: BORLOTTO
Description:
MERCATO OL
bo06
Red and beige speckled dwarf bean with uniformly shaped pods. The 6â€“8 beans per pod are round and shiny with red stripes. Sturdy, straight-growing, consistently maturing, heat-tolerant plants.
Type: bush shell bean

Name: BORLOTTO
Description:
ROSSO
bo08
Shell bean with green pods, speckled with red. Shell beans are robust and undemanding but need enough warmth for maturation.
Type: bush shell bean

Name: CANADIAN
Description:
WONDER
bo16
Vigorously-growing bean for dry seed use. Young green tender pods tasty, too, but mostly grown for their deep red seeds.
Type: bush shell bean

Name: CANTARE
Description:
bo47
Good cropping bean, stands up well, round pods of approx. 8 mm diameter. Resistant to bean mosaic virus 1 and bean anthracnose.
Type: filet bush bean

Name: CRESO
Description:
bo43
Attractive pale yellow wax bean. The long, pencil-thin pods are string-free. This early ripening and vigorous bush bean can be harvested for a long time.
Type: bush wax bean

Name: NEW
Description:
CUPIDON
bo54
Fast growing and good cropping French variety. Can be harvested young as filet bean, or later as stringless pod bean. Easy to harvest. Resistant to bean mosaic virus 1 and bean anthracnose.
Type: filet bush bean

Name: null
Description: null

Name: ELMORO
Description:
bo56
Very vigorous and persistent flowering variety. The straight, green pods are full of flavor. The black seed color is especially pretty when mature. Suitable for outdoor cultivation and under protection.
Type: filet bush bean

Name: FLA
Description:
DEUX
bo17
Robust variety with delicately-flavoured beans, highly appreciated in French cuisine. The beans can be harvested green and fade to (off)-white when dried. The whole green pods are edible, the beans can be used fresh or dried. Flageolet beans are a delicacy in traditional French cuisine.
Type: flageolet bush bean

Explanations: Conservation Breeding: For this variety Sativa practices conservation breeding in Rheinau. To ensure high-quality varieties, they must be maintained. They are regularly replicated and selected by their positive characteristics. In doing so the varieties are continually improved and adapted to growing conditions.
Name: GOLDFIELD
Description:
bo71
Bountiful early variety with long, very broad flat golden-yellow pods. Suitable for open or protected cultivation.
Type: climbing bean

Description: null

Name: LA
Description:
VICTOIRE
 bo30
Medium to early, good cropper. Green, round to oval stringless pods, easy to harvest. Suitable for almost all locations. Stands up well.
Type: bush bean

Explanations: Conservation Breeding: For this variety Sativa practices conservation breeding in Rheinau. To ensure high-quality varieties, they must be maintained. They are regularly replicated and selected by their positive characteristics. In doing so the varieties are continually improved and adapted to growing conditions.
Name: MARONA
Description:
bo23
Early bean, seeds beige in colour, green and round to oval pods. Good cropper. Fast initial growth and good early harvest, also suitable for protected and autumn cultivation.
Type: bush bean

Name: MAXI
Description:
bo36
Upright growth, pods located on top of foliage ("sitting hen variety"). The 18-20 cm long pods are thus easy to harvest, as they hang in the open. Early, good cropper, for open and protected cultivation.
Type: bush bean

Name: NECKARGOLD
Description:
bo77
Round to oval, long, dark yellow pods. Early to medium harvest season, excellent cropper. Tender, fleshy bean with excellent taste. No strings.
Type: climbing bean

Explanations: ProSpecieRara: This variety has been awarded by ProSpecieRara as a rare or old variety. ProSpecieRara is a foundation dedicated to preserving the diversity of rare plant varieties. In long-term cooperation with ProSpecieRara, Sativa is active in the important preservation and cultivation of these traditional varieties.
Name: ODESSA
Description:
bo48
Sturdy, high-yielding variety with round, mid-green pods. Easy to pick and has a long harvesting period. Resistant to Bean Common Mosaic Virus and Bean Spot.
Type: filet bush bean

Name: PURPLE
Description:
QUEEN
bo59
Purple dwarf bean that turns green when cooked. Productive variety that can be sown early and copes well with cool, wet weather. Tender, stringless pods, excellent taste.
Type: bush bean

Name: PURPLE
Description:
TEEPEE
bo58
Good cropper, stringless blue-purple pods, which are located on top of the foliage ("sitting hen variety"). Thus easy to harvest, and beans tend to stay disease-free. Pod colour changes to dark green during cooking.
Type: bush bean

Explanations: Conservation Breeding: For this variety Sativa practices conservation breeding in Rheinau. To ensure high-quality varieties, they must be maintained. They are regularly replicated and selected by their positive characteristics. In doing so the varieties are continually improved and adapted to growing conditions.
Name: SCARLET
Description:
EMPEROR
bo82
Glorious bright scarlet flowers, tasty runner bean. Mature pods stringy, but easy to remove. Vigorous variety suitable for exposed and rainy locations.
Type: runner bean

Explanations: Conservation Breeding: For this variety Sativa practices conservation breeding in Rheinau. To ensure high-quality varieties, they must be maintained. They are regularly replicated and selected by their positive characteristics. In doing so the varieties are continually improved and adapted to growing conditions.
Name: TREBONA
Description:
bo64
Very early, high-yielding variety for growing under cover and outdoors. The mid-green pods have a medium-width, flat oval shape.
Type: climbing bean
